content:
Diagnosis:		Unclassified renal cell carcinoma, TFE3 rearrangement positive

Management:		Right radical nephrectomy 15 March 2024

Histology:		pT3aN0M0 unclassified renal cell carcinoma
			TFE3 rearrangement confirmed on FISH testing
			Clear resection margins

Current Situation:	First post-operative follow-up

[redacted name] attended clinic today following his right radical nephrectomy. He has made an excellent recovery from surgery with good wound healing. His post-operative pain has largely resolved and he has returned to most normal activities. His appetite has improved and he reports gaining 2kg since discharge. Blood pressure is well controlled at 132/78mmHg. Blood tests show stable renal function with creatinine 98 umol/L. Chest x-ray shows no evidence of metastatic disease.

The plan is for surveillance with 3-monthly CT chest/abdomen/pelvis for the first year. I have arranged the first scan for June 2024 and will review him afterwards with the results. He has my contact details should any concerns arise in the interim.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: unclassified renal cell carcinoma, clear resection margins
primary_cancer.biomarker_status: TFE3 rearrangement positive confirmed by FISH

cancer_timeline.value: TFE3 rearrangement confirmed positive on FISH testing
Chest x-ray shows no evidence of metastatic disease

patient_facts.value: Stable renal function with creatinine 98 umol/L
Returned to most normal activities, gained 2kg since discharge

status_updates.value: Stage IIB unclassified renal cell carcinoma status post right radical nephrectomy. Excellent post-operative recovery with no evidence of metastatic disease.
Excellent recovery from surgery with resolved post-operative pain and return to normal activities
Review after CT scan in June 2024
